pull.title: guix: remove cURL from build env

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [hebasto](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27779#pullrequestreview-1458997060), [TheCharlatan](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27779#pullrequestreview-1462683737) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

It is not clear why this is a fix. `CMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_CURL` is a valid [variable](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/variable/CMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_PackageName.html) that:
> can be used to build a project without an optional package
Btw, do we still need this line https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/f467b28ac35add304442f30c2a05ef5d9df496e2/contrib/guix/manifest.scm#L14 at all?

[`0ef5b6b796a5d357...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/f467b28ac35add304442f30c2a05ef5d9df496e2/guix_build.log) | [`f7783dddf98519b8...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/00dc9d5b6d1575aaeeb33af3789b36e4f90a3bfb/guix_build.log) | | guix_build.log.diff | | [`a25fc54e9b38ee39...`](https://drahtbot.space/guix/bitcoin/bitcoin/00dc9d5b6d1575aaeeb33af3789b36e4f90a3bfb/guix_build.log.diff) |

> It is not clear why this is a fix. `CMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_CURL` is a valid [variable](https://cmake.org/cmake/help/latest/variable/CMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_PackageName.html) that:
> 
> > can be used to build a project without an optional package

Considering the `FindCURL` module [source code](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/blob/master/Modules/FindCURL.cmake), I believe that the current using of the `CMAKE_DISABLE_FIND_PACKAGE_CURL` variable is optimal.

FWIW, the build log contains `-- Could NOT find CURL (missing: CURL_LIBRARY CURL_INCLUDE_DIR)` for either variants. It is even possible to drop `(arguments '(#:configure-flags ...))` altogether. But again, the current code in the master branch is the optimal shortcut.

committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1685719967 +0100

guix: remove cURL from build env

events.message: guix: remove cURL from build env

rename.from: guix: fix CURL disable flag in osslsigncode
rename.to: guix: remove cURL from build env

events.body:
> is the optimal shortcut.

I think I'd rather remove all the dead code. The option confusion comes from the fact that these flags seem to just fail silently if the relevant libraries haven't been compiled/installed with CMake, which I was look at for 2.6.

ACK 641897a83dc9d40b618efbae67c3beb90a1f34f8
